page.title: 02ARMED FORCES C. CROOKHAM
page.content: Our group visited the British Headquarters of the Gurkhas in Sandy Lane. The barracks are wooden huts. These housed the R.A.M.C. during World War II.The men sleep in dorimtories for 12 and each man has a wardrobe and locker.They shared an ironing table and an electic kettle and a duty board. Meals are communal and there is a Hindu priest on the site.While stationed in Crookham Gurkhas do plenty of fitness training as well as their other duties. The Gurkha band has a practice nearly every morning . Gurkhas are good at hill running and prefer it to flat ground.They are very good infantry men,and often win trophies at the annual Bisley Rifle competitions.The Gurkha pipe band plays at local carnivals and fetes,and many fairs have Gurkha curry stalls.
